data.title: Big well-managed place with big comfortable concrete bar
data.text:
Drifter's has since it opened seemed to like more of a serious and established bar-scene bar that much of our downtown offerings.  It features a large open space with exposed-HVAC industrial décor befitting the showpiece of the establishment, the long concrete bar.

While the size and starkness of the place might lend a feeling of sterility or lack of intimacy, it resists being too college-y or too yuppie or too stuffy, and serves as a modern and comfortable place to meet friends for drinks with occasional trivia offerings and the like - a reliable bar experience stemming from thoughtful investment of resources, with well-trained friendly staff and convenient location. Not a bad place to meet up and start your night, perhaps with an order from next-door Garcia's pizza being passed through the adjacent dumbwaiter.
